messages.message: Hallo there my dearest Sultan! A pleasure to meet you 😄
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Hallo there my dearest Sultan! A pleasure to meet you 😄'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F ANK - BLA, A SMY - CON, A CON - BUL. Should I trust FRANCE?
messages.output: You should not trust the message. The friendly and casual tone in the message from France does not guarantee their sincerity, especially when their recommended order for you is not aligned with your best interest as Turkey.

messages.message: Just a head up here, Austria wants food relations with me currently but wants me to have Rum. I will go for it but I expect you will take it with support which is OK with me.
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'Just a head up here, Austria wants food relations with me currently but wants me to have Rum. I will go for it but I expect you will take it with support which is OK with me.'.

messages.output: You should not trust the message. The dismissive and slightly playful response from France, along with their denial of involvement in your plans to collaborate against Austria, may indicate a lack of sincerity or potential deception.

messages.output: You should trust the message. France's inquiry about your strategy towards Italy indicates a willingness to coordinate and collaborate with you, aligning with your orders to focus on your moves to Italy.
